titlestmt.titleproper: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Clement Lawrence Smith papers (series 65) 1844-1952 1909-1913
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Clement Lawrence Smith papers (series 65)

bioghist.p: Clement Lawrence Smith (1844-1909) served on the faculty of Haverford College, Swarthmore College, and Harvard University. He was married to Emma Griscom Smith, a great-granddaughter of Charles Wilson Peale. They had a son, George Lawrence Smith.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains pamphlets, photographs, and biographical sketches related to Clement L. Smith. The collection also contains legal materials and correspondence relating to the Clement L. Smith Estate.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
